sub_title: Master of Logic at University of Amsterdam
summary:
I got my Bachelor's in Mathematics at the University of Liege with highest praise. After that, I decided to join the Master of Logic at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation (ILLC) in Amsterdam, and specialised in abstract mathematics and theoretical computer science.
My main research topics include logic, algebra, topology and category theory, as well as the connections between these topics.

I also have some experience in programming. Throughout my education, I mastered languages such as Python, C, Java and Haskell and acquired skills such as object-oriented programming, functional programming and formal verification (using proof assistants).
My theoretical computer science knowledge ranges over lambda calculus, various type theories, automata theory and complexity theory.

For a survey of my writing samples, please have a look at my personal webpage. For an overview of my programming projects, you can consult my GitHub profile.
